intro: Nasturtium rotundifolium, commonly known as round-leafed nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves and vibrant orange or yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is known for its edible leaves and seeds, which have a peppery taste. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often growing in rocky or arid environments. Nasturtium rotundifolium is also valued for its ornamental appeal and use in companion planting to deter pests in gardens.
